title: Eravikulam National Park
short_description: A high-altitude national park in Munnar, Kerala, home to the endangered Nilgiri Tahr and Anamudi peak.
long_description: Eravikulam National Park is a 97 km2 national park located along the Western Ghats in the Idukki district of Kerala in India. Situated a short drive from Munnar, it is the first national park in Kerala. The park represents the largest and most pristine stretch of Shola-Grassland ecosystem in the Western Ghats. It is administered by the Kerala Department of Forests and Wildlife, Munnar Wildlife Division. The main attraction is the Nilgiri Tahr, an endangered mountain goat. Anamudi, the highest peak in South India (2,695 m), is located within this park.
wildlife_significance: Holds the largest viable population of the endangered Nilgiri Tahr.
guides_and_tips: Private vehicles are parked at the entrance. Forest department buses take visitors up the hill. Book online to avoid long queues.
how_to_reach: By Air: Kochi (135 km). By Rail: Aluva (120 km). By Road: 15 km from Munnar town.
permits_and_fees: Online booking is highly recommended especially during peak season.
conservation_notes: Breeding season closer (calving) usually in Feb-March.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive Munnar. Day 2: Morning visit to Eravikulam. Bus ride to Rajamalai. Walk to viewpoint. Afternoon visit Tea Museum. Day 3: Mattupetty Dam. Departure.
safety_tips: Mists can roll in quickly; carry a jacket.

opening_hours.time_notes: Park closes for calving season (usually Feb-March).

operating_season.best_months: September to January, April to June
operating_season.season_notes: Check website for exact calving closure dates.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Bus queues can be long if not booked online.
